# Qualité des données

## Corrélations anormales

```{r}
#| label: cor-prep

corx <- function(prof, titx) {
  tit <- paste0("Corrélations ", titx)
  prof |>
    remove_constant() |>
    mutate_if(is.factor, as.numeric) |>
    dplyr::select(!formule_sys) |>
    ggcorr(drop = TRUE, hjust = 0.9) +
    labs(title = tit,
         y = "n",
         caption = "Corrélations. Validation interne du questionnaire.") +
    theme_minimal() +
    theme(
      plot.title = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
      plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12),
      axis.title.x = element_blank(),
      legend.title = element_blank(),
      axis.title.y = element_blank(),
      ,
      axis.text.x = element_text(size = 12),
      axis.text.y = element_text(size = 12),
      legend.position = "right"
    )
}
```

```{r}
#| label: fig-corregul
#| fig-cap: Corrélations internes
patients |>
  corx("Patients")
```

Il n'y a apas de corrélation *anormale pouvant géner l'analyse.
